Line 110: Line 110:      
Noted psychologist [[Eric Fromm]] also maintained in his book "[[The art of loving]]" that love is not merely a feeling but is also actions, and that in fact, the "feeling" of love is superficial in comparison to ones commitment to love via a series of loving actions over time.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> In this sense, Fromm held that love is ultimately not a feeling at all, but rather is a commitment to, and adherence to, loving actions towards another, ones self, or many others, over a sustained duration.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> Fromm also described Love as a conscious choice that in it's early stages might originate as an involuntary feeling, but which then later no longer depends on those feelings, but rather depends only on conscious commitment.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref>
 
Noted psychologist [[Eric Fromm]] also maintained in his book "[[The art of loving]]" that love is not merely a feeling but is also actions, and that in fact, the "feeling" of love is superficial in comparison to ones commitment to love via a series of loving actions over time.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> In this sense, Fromm held that love is ultimately not a feeling at all, but rather is a commitment to, and adherence to, loving actions towards another, ones self, or many others, over a sustained duration.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> Fromm also described Love as a conscious choice that in it's early stages might originate as an involuntary feeling, but which then later no longer depends on those feelings, but rather depends only on conscious commitment.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (September 5, 2000), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref>
